When a beam is subjected to a couple it bends. The filaments lying on the inner or the concave side gets compressed while those lying on the outer or the convex side get elongated. 

In between these two portions, there is layer in which the filaments are neither compressed nor elongated. It is called the neutral surface.


The curvature changes along the length of the beam being zero at the origin O, where the beam is fixed.
